com.lime.core
Class DomainContextManager

java.lang.Object
  com.lime.core.DomainContextManager

public class DomainContextManager
extends java.lang.Object

The class is the core of SpringLime It acts as a repository for the applications, manages the application loaders and exposes the two static methods moduleDeployed and moduleUndeployed to register and unregister a module in your domain context. Note that due to the use of static properties, this class must be unique for all of the modules of an application. This usually means this class must be deployed in the shared libraries of your server or domain.

Author:
Daniele Milani

Method Summary
static void moduleDeployed(Module module)
          This method registers a module for the lime context.
static void moduleUndeployed(Module module)
          This method unregisters a module for the lime context.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

moduleDeployed

public static void moduleDeployed(Module module)
This method registers a module for the lime context. The module's name is matched with all of the configured applications, if an application has defined this module as one of its own, the module is passed to the application loader. If the module is the last required for an application, the application context is started.

Parameters:
module - the module to register

moduleUndeployed

public static void moduleUndeployed(Module module)
This method unregisters a module for the lime context. The module's is matched with all of the configured applications, if an application has this module in its deployed modules, the module is unregistered and removed. If the module is required and the application is running, the application context is stopped.

Parameters:
module - the module to unregister
